original: I am having an inordinately hard time pursuing my amorous interest in [target_seduced.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. When will I ever find the time to travel so far?
translation: 向[target_seduced.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]求爱真是让我受罪。我何时能有时间去如此远的地方？

original: My current occupation simply leaves me with no time to chase [target_seduced.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] - or anyone else for that matter.
translation: 我现在的工作让我无暇去追求[target_seduced.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]——或其他任何人。

original: The target of my amorous attentions, [target_seduced.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], simply never seems to be around!
translation: 我的追求对象，[target_seduced.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]，似乎就没出现过！

original: I should give up... for now.
translation: 我应当放弃……暂时来说。

original: There is no rush!
translation: 不着急！

original: Stop Seduction
translation: 停止勾引

original: Stop my ongoing seduction effort. Perhaps I should focus on someone else...
translation: 停止我现在的勾引企图。或许我应当专注于其他人……

original: Seduction ends
translation: 勾引终止

original: Stop Seduction
translation: 停止勾引

original: Stop trying to seduce §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]§!. I should turn my attentions elsewhere...
translation: 停止对§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]§!的勾引企图。我应当把我的注意力放到别处……

original: Stop Spying
translation: 停止监视

original: Cease spying on my current target. There are so many other suspects...
translation: 停止监视我的现有目标。还有很多人可以监视……

original: Spying ends
translation: 监视终止

original: Stop Spying On
translation: 停止监视

original: Stop spying on §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]§!. I should turn my attention elsewhere...
translation: 停止监视§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]§!。或许我应当专注于其他人……

original: A group of raiders are threatening the trade in our realm. My liege, [Liege.GetTitledFirstName], has ordered me to go after their leader, and make sure that the roads are safe for caravans.
translation: 一群匪徒对我们境内的贸易产生威胁。我的领主，[Liege.GetTitledFirstName]，命令我消灭他们的头领，确保商队在路上的安全。

original: It is my duty.
translation: 这是我的使命。

original: I won't risk my life against the dangerous bandits.
translation: 我不能为了这危险的强盗冒生命危险。

original: Refusing orders while give my liege a reason to arrest me.
translation: 拒绝命令，然而会让领主有借口逮捕我。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] brought forth to me the head of the raiders' leader, of the bandit leader whom previously plagued merchants in [FromFrom.GetName].
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName]把之前袭击[FromFrom.GetName]商人的强盗首领的脑袋带给了我。

original: Excellent work!
translation: 好样的！

original: In the late afternoon [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s horse arrived home riderless. There's no telling what the raiders have done to [From.GetHerHim].
translation: 一天傍晚，[From.GetTitledFirstName]的坐骑被放了回来。不知道那些强盗对[From.GetHerHim]做了什么。

original: What a horrible fate.
translation: 真是可怕的命运。

original: I need to deal with these rascals personally.
translation: 我要亲自处理这些流氓。

original: Get the soldiers to chase them out.
translation: 让士兵解决他们。

original: The coward [From.GetTitledFirstName] deemed it too dangerous to interfere with the caravan raiders, and refused to carry out my orders. I could have [From.GetHerHim] arrested for this, however, that would not solve the problem of merchants being attacked on my trade routes.
translation: 胆小的[From.GetTitledFirstName]认为干涉商队的劫匪太过危险，拒绝执行我的命令。我有逮捕[From.GetHerHim]的借口了，但商队被袭击的问题并不会因此解决。

original: I need to deal with my unruly marshal.
translation: 我要处理这个任性的军事总管。

original: I have to root out the raiders myself.
translation: 我必须自己铲除这帮匪徒。

original: Organize soldiers to take care of the raiders.
translation: 组织士兵解决匪徒。

original: [From.GetTitledFirstName] arrives bruised and alone from his venture to drive away the raiders. Unfortunately he brings the news that he has been unable to fight off the raiders from our land.
translation: [From.GetTitledFirstName]鼻青脸肿地从匪徒处独自逃了回来。很不幸他没能处理掉我们土地上的劫匪。

original: Annoying pests!
translation: 烦人的害虫！

original: After the sunset I manage to track down the raiders encampment. Me and my men decide to...
translation: 日落后，我想办法找到了匪徒的营地。我和我的手下决定……

original: ... enter the camp and approach their leader.
translation: ……进入营地直接找到首领。

original: ... wait until midnight and sneak up on the guards.
translation: ……等到半夜，偷袭守卫。

original: As we enter the camp, we pass clusters of tents and campfires. While I can only see a small group of raiders, I can feel many eyes upon me. Approaching the center of the settlement, a silhouette - who I assume is the leader of the raiders - exits a large tent, and greets me with a smirk.
translation: 我们进入营地，穿过帐篷和营火。我只能看到一小撮劫匪，但能感觉到实际还有很多眼睛在看着我。到了营地中心，一个人影——我猜测他是首领——从一个大帐篷里走出，对我轻蔑地笑着。

original: Fight the leader to shatter the band of raiders.
translation: 攻击首领以击垮匪徒。

original: Bribe the raiders to leave my land.
translation: 收买匪徒让他们离开我的土地。

original: Diplomatically explain why they can't harass travellers.
translation: 老练地解释他们为何不能袭扰路人。

original: While engaged in a fairly one-sided conversation about property and rights, I fail to notice the thug sneaking up behind me. I just barely notice their leader making a subtle nodding motion before a sharp blow to the back of my head robs me of consciousness.
translation: 在一番单方面对于财产和权利的说教后，我没有注意到一个恶徒潜行到我身后。我刚注意到首领轻轻点了点头，我挨了一记闷棍然后晕了过去。

original: Ow!
translation: 嗷喔！

original: I'm brought to consciousness by the sound of laughter and shouts. As my eyes adjust to the unforgiving sunlight, I realize that I have been tied up. The raiders have dressed me in silly clothes and are parading me around town, demanding a pile of gold in return for my freedom.
translation: 我被笑声和喊声吵醒。我的眼睛好不容易才适应了严酷的眼光，发现自己的被绑了起来。匪徒让我穿上愚蠢的衣服并在城镇里游街，并索要一堆金币作为我的赎金。

original: Pay them for my freedom.
translation: 赎回我的自由。

original: Plead for mercy.
translation: 祈求怜悯。

original: As we are closing in on the raiders' camp we count on the cover of darkness to keep us from sight. This turns out to be a foolish mistake, as we abruply find ourselves both surrounded and outnumbered.
translation: 在我们接近匪徒营地时一片黑压压人阻挡了我们的视线。看来我做了愚蠢的决定，我们被更多人包围了。

original: Surrender.
translation: 投降。

original: Let's dance!
translation: 让我们来玩一玩！

original: After subduing the guards on watch we enter the leader's tent. While he's fast asleep I draw my blade, placing it with great precision against his throat. Suddenly his eyes flicker open, and his gaze wanders the tent with a dazed urgency. I realize that if I do not act quickly, he may very well draw attention to us.
translation: 在解决掉放哨的守卫后我们进入了首领的帐篷。在他熟睡中，我抽刀精确地架在了他的喉咙。突然他双眼眨了眨，视线紧张又迷糊地观察帐篷。不赶快处理他将会给我带来大麻烦。

original: Threaten him to leave my land!
translation: 威胁他离开我的土地！

original: Slit his throat and fight our way out.
translation: 抹了他的喉咙然后杀出去。

original: Caravan Raiders
translation: 商队劫掠者

original: Raiders are ravaging the countryside making it difficult to conduct trade in this county.
translation: 匪徒们正在劫掠郊区，这让这个省份的贸易变得困难。

original: Caravan Guards
translation: 商队护卫

original: Commissioned caravan guards protects the trade in this county
translation: 现役商队护卫队保护着这个省份的贸易

original: Trade Governor
translation: 贸易长官

original: The trade in this county is supervised by a proficient administrator.
translation: 这个省份的贸易由一位有经验的管理者领导。

original: Refused Order
translation: 拒绝命令

original: Dung Collector
translation: 挑粪工

original: Surge of traders
translation: 贸易浪潮

original: Chinese Embargo
translation: 天朝禁运

original: Publicly Humiliated
translation: 公开羞辱

original: Commander
translation: 指挥官

original: Appoint Leader
translation: 任命队长

original: Appoint Commander
translation: 任命指挥官

original: Appoint §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W as one of your Commanders.
translation: 任命§Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§!为你的指挥官。

original: Only the Ruler, his or her Marshal and those who are appointed Commanders may lead armies into battle.
translation: 只有统治者、军事总管和指挥官能够带领部队作战。

original: Commander Appointed
translation: 任命为指挥官

original: §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W was appointed Commander by §Y[Actor.GetBestName]§W
translation: §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§!被§Y[Actor.GetBestName]§!任命为指挥官

original: Commander Appointment Rejected
translation: 拒绝指挥官的任命

original: §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W rejected the Commander appointment by §Y[Actor.GetBestName]§W
translation: §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§!拒绝了§Y[Actor.GetBestName]§!对其指挥官的任命

original: Relieve Commander
translation: 解除指挥官职务

original: Relieve §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W of [Recipient.GetHerHis] duties as a Commander
translation: 解除§Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§! [Recipient.GetHerHis]作为指挥官的职责

original: If a Commander gets injured, sick or old it might be a good idea to relieve them of their duties
translation: 如果指挥官受伤、生病或太老，最好解除他们的职责

original: Commander Relieved
translation: 指挥权被解除

original: §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W must not already be a part of §Y[Actor.GetBestName]'s§W Council
translation: §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§!必须不是§Y[Actor.GetBestName]§!内阁的成员

original: [Root.GetFirstName] becomes pregnant
translation: [Root.GetFirstName]怀孕了

original: Hiding somewhere around §Y$LOCATION$§!
translation: 躲藏在§Y$LOCATION$§!附近

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, had this stone raised in [Root.GetHerHis] own memory while [Root.GetSheHe] lived. May [Root.GetSheHe] be remembered with joy and happiness.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，在[Root.GetSheHe]生前即树立此石以纪念[Root.GetHerHis]功业。愿[Root.GetSheHe]以欢乐与幸福被铭记。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, had this stone raised in memory of [Root.GetHerselfHimself] in his own lifetime. Let it be said that [Root.GetHerHis] love for mead and spirits was second to none.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，在他有生之年树立此石以纪念[Root.GetHerselfHimself]。愿千古传颂[Root.GetHerHis]无人能比的对蜜酒和烈酒的爱。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, ordered this stone raised during [Root.GetHerHis] own lifetime. It is true that [Root.GetHerHis] beauty and fair features were without equal in all the lands settled by men. Alfr carved, Einarr painted.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，命令在[Root.GetHerHis]生前即树立此石。千真万确，[Root.GetHerHis]美丽和美貌在全部有人居住的土地都无有匹敌。此石由阿尔夫雕刻，埃纳尔作画。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, had this stone carved in [Root.GetHerHis] own memory. Though [Root.GetSheHe] was slight of size, [Root.GetFirstName] had the will of a giant. Oddr carved this memorial while [Root.GetSheHe] lived.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，雕塑此石以纪念[Root.GetHerHis]功业。即便[Root.GetSheHe]身形渺小，[Root.GetFirstName]却有着巨人的意志。此石由奥特在[Root.GetSheHe]生前雕刻。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

This stone was raised by [Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, to celebrate [Root.GetHerHis] great wisdom. Truly no greater thinker lived in this era, or the ones before. Toke carved these runes.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

此石由[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]树立，以庆贺[Root.GetHerHis]睿智。同时代没有比他更杰出的思想家，前人中也未曾出现。此石由托克雕刻。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName] the Hapless, [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, somehow managed to see this stone raised in [Root.GetHerHis] own memory. Many said [Root.GetSheHe] was worthless and would amount to nothing, and perhaps they were right. The great Tjudmund, whose skill with women was legendary, took pity and carved these words.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

倒霉蛋[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，，不知怎的居然成功看到此石树立以纪念[Root.GetHerHis]生平。很多人说[Root.GetSheHe]碌碌无为、一文不名，或许他们是对的。伟大的居德蒙德，征服的女人数不胜数，大发善心雕刻了这些文字。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, commanded that this stone be erected in [Root.GetHerHis] lifetime. It was said that [Root.GetSheHe] had the strength of ten men, and no one dared oppose this claim. The stone was carved by Orm.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，下令树立此石以铭记[Root.GetHerHis]一生。据说[Root.GetSheHe]能以一当十，没人敢对他挑战。此石由奥姆雕刻。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName] the Learned, [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, asked for this stone to be raised in [Root.GetHerHis] name. The knowledge [Root.GetSheHe] held of the world and all of its wonders was the envy of all. Hrolfr carved these words.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

博学的[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野的[Root.GetSonDaughter]，要求以[Root.GetHerHis]名义树立其这块石头。[Root.GetSheHe]对大千世界的认知被所有人嫉妒。此石由罗尔夫雕刻。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, had this stone raised and painted with the blood of [Root.GetHerHis] enemies while [Root.GetSheHe] still lived. Those foolish enough to go against [Root.GetFirstName] met their end impaled on a pole. Egil carved these runes before he suffered this very fate.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，在[Root.GetSheHe]生前即树立这块石头并涂上[Root.GetHerHis]敌人的鲜血。那些反对[Root.GetFirstName]的蠢货最终都丧命于木桩穿刺之刑。此石由埃吉尔在遭受此命运之前雕刻。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

This stone was raised by [Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, to celebrate the beauty of the world. Like a shining rainbow or the glittering sea, [Root.GetFirstName] brought joy and light into the life of those who met [Root.GetHerHim]. Asbjörn reluctantly carved these words.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

此石由[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]树立以庆祝美好的世界。如同亮丽的彩虹和波澜的大海，[Root.GetFirstName]给见到[Root.GetHerHim]的人带来喜悦和光明。此石由阿斯比昂不情愿地雕刻。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, likely parent of countless bastards, had this stone raised in memory of [Root.GetHerselfHimself]. Let no one deny the love [Root.GetSheHe] felt for others. Anund carved, Gorm painted.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野的[Root.GetSonDaughter]，可能是众多私生子的父母，树立这块石头纪念[Root.GetHerselfHimself]。没人否认[Root.GetSheHe]对别人的爱。此石由埃南德雕刻，格姆作画。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, raised this stone in [Root.GetHerHis] own lifetime. Like no one before [Root.GetHerHim], [Root.GetFirstName] could appreciate a good meal. Here is the recipe for roasted boar the way [Root.GetSheHe] prefers it...

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之Root.GetSonDaughter]，在[Root.GetHerHis]生前树立此石。从没有人像[Root.GetHerHim]一样，[Root.GetFirstName]最能品位上佳的菜肴。以下是[Root.GetSheHe]最喜欢的烤乳猪的方式……

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, had this stone erected with the help of Sigtrygg. Throughout the land, [Root.GetFirstName] was known for [Root.GetHerHis] great charity to others. No wanderer seeking food or shelter at one of [Root.GetHerHis] holdings was turned away.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，在希特里克的帮助下树立了这块石头。在全世界，[Root.GetFirstName]以[Root.GetHerHis]博爱而闻名。没有一个在[Root.GetHerHis]领地寻求食物或住所的流浪汉被拒之门外。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

This stone was raised by [Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, who was renowned for [Root.GetHerHis] great kindness to all things living. May [Root.GetSheHe] be treated by all others, now and in the afterlife, in that same manner.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

此石由[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]树立，[Root.GetHerHis]和蔼不分贵贱，世人皆知。愿[Root.GetSheHe]生前和死后也被他人同样善良地对待。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName] the Great, [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, raised this stone to honor the legacy of [Root.GetHerHis] famous deeds. In the world of Men, no one was [Root.GetHerHis] equal.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

伟大者[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，树立此石以荣耀[Root.GetHerHis]传奇遗产。在人间，无人能与[Root.GetHerHis]力量匹敌。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

The words on this stone belong to [Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, but the carving was done by Tyke and Ragnvald painted. Let it be known that [Root.GetFirstName] lived a simple life without distractions, grateful for the company and friendship those around [Root.GetHerHim] provided.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

此石上的话语献给[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，此石由泰克雕刻，朗瓦尔德作画。愿天下皆知[Root.GetFirstName]生活简朴不受诱惑，感激[Root.GetHerHim]周边的人给予的陪伴和友情。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

While [Root.GetSheHe] still lived, [Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, had this stone raised in [Root.GetHerHis] own memory. Even [Root.GetHerHis] enemies cannot deny the great courage of [Root.GetFirstName]. Those who knew [Root.GetHerHim] can swear that when faced with danger, [Root.GetSheHe] was always without fear.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

在[Root.GetSheHe]生前，[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，树立这块石头以纪念[Root.GetHerHis]功业。即使[Root.GetHerHis]敌人也不能否认[Root.GetFirstName]的勇气。认识[Root.GetHerHim]的那些人可以发誓，当遇到危险的时候，[Root.GetSheHe]总是无所畏惧。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, had this stone raised in [Root.GetHerHis] own lifetime. There was no one more fair and just in all things. Men and women traveled far to seek [Root.GetHerHis] counsel in disputes. Kolbjörn carved these runes.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，在[Root.GetHerHis]生前树立此石。没有人比其更能公正公平的对待一切，男女都长途跋涉寻求[Root.GetHerHis]一件解决分歧。此石由科比昂雕刻。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, ordered this stone raised in honor of the Gods. No one was more devoted to Odin, and no one was more deserving of a place in Valhalla. These runes were carved by Grim and painted by Borkvard.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，命令树立此石以荣耀诸神。没有人更崇拜奥丁，没有人更有资格进入瓦尔哈拉殿堂。此石由格里姆雕刻，伯克瓦德绘画。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, ordered this stone raised in the name of Christ and Saint Michael. May God preserve [Root.GetHerHis] soul, and lead [Root.GetHerHim] safely to light and paradise. These runes were carved by Thorolf and painted by Balder.

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，命令以基督和圣米迦勒的名义树立此石。愿上帝保护[Root.GetHerHis]灵魂，引导[Root.GetHerHim]安全的进入光明和天堂。此石由所鲁尔福雕刻，巴尔德作画。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。

original:
The runestone you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the runes:

[Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the wild, had these runes carved in [Root.GetHerHis] own lifetime. No one was more feared than [Root.GetFirstName] in the realm of Men, and [Root.GetHerHis] enemies suffered the pains of a thousand deaths for daring to oppose [Root.GetHerHim].

You leave the stone, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these rune carvings in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
translation:
定做的符文石已完成并树立在你指定的地点。你细读符文：

[Root.GetFirstName]，荒野之[Root.GetSonDaughter]，在[Root.GetHerHis]生前雕刻这些符文。没有人比[Root.GetFirstName]更令人恐惧，[Root.GetHerHis]那些敌人胆敢反对[Root.GetHerHim]，都饱受万劫之苦。

你满意地离开了这块石头，知道即便几个世纪过去，石上的颜色早已斑驳，学者们也会研究此符文的刻画，只求一窥其话语中蕴藏的智慧。
